channel.title: Should I code then design? or Design then code?
channel.description:
Should I code then design or Design then code?
[hr]
[center][size=20pt][b]Choice Made[/b][/size][/center]
I decided to code my design first then make it.

item.title: Should I code then design? or Design then code?
item.dc:creator: @fluffymuff1n fluffymuff1n
item.description:
@fluffymuff1n wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:10, topic:184448”][quote author=fluffymuff1n link=topic=246123.msg2077466#msg2077466 date=1204188034]
what i did, think of the idea, if you have to write it down, otherwise start making the images and coding at the same time.
[/quote]
Design, code, redesign, recode, redesign, recode, release.
Imo.[/quote]
when i designer first, i make it all in images…

Read full topic

item.title: Should I code then design? or Design then code?
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

in my opinion, It is best to at least make a way to see the output first and not just a bunch of echo $thing."
";
I would advise to just make a way to “comfortably” see the outputs (like a fill-in-the-blank html output) then code, and add design as you need it.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I code then design? or Design then code?

item.description:

I would suggest that you design now… And after you get a design you like start coding it.

like they said ^^

item.source: Should I code then design? or Design then code?

item.title: Should I code then design? or Design then code?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Don’t know how it is in PHP, but I program Java, so here’s how I go about.
Get a rough idea of how I want it to be designed like, then code. As I go along, add things to the map.

Regecks told me to design my code like it was a human body + mind interaction.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I code then design? or Design then code?

item.title: Should I code then design? or Design then code?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I used to try making an amazing theme, then code something up (like my blog), and it inevitably ended up sucking. I tried designing a REALLY simple theme, (like this) for my CMS/templating system, and so far it’s be working out really well. I’d design a nice looking theme, but don’t try curved corners, or drop shadows etc, just make it look as simple as possible. But you must design your code so it can be easily themeable when your done coding (templating, MVC). When you have your code working, start designing a cool theme, get your theme working, then apply the theme to your code. I personally like the PEAR HTML_Template_IT package, because it’s very simple to use, and all you have to do is go {SomeTemplateVar} in your markup.
Good luck.

Read full topic
item.source: Should I code then design? or Design then code?
